page.title: 13MUNCASTER CHURCH RAVENGLASS
page.content: The church is 12th.century and is in Muncaster Castle grounds.It is the parish church of Ravenglass,but as it is about 2 miles uphill away from the village there is a consecrated parish room next to the village hall.Services are held alternately between the two places.Weddings,christenings and funerals are all held at the church. The Book of Common Prayer is used for most of the services. It is part of the combined parish of Waberthwaite,Ravenglass,Irton and Eskdale.The vicar is the Reverend Michael Smith,who is also rector of Waberthwaite.He lives 7 miles away in a vicarage in Eskdale. Both churches are Anglican and are in the diocese of Carlisle.
